roleset.name: assign criminal punishment

example.name: all args
example.text: Dallas District Judge Jack Hampton had sparked calls for a judicial inquiry with his remarks to the press last December , two weeks after sentencing an 18 - year - old defendant to 30 years in state prison for killing two homosexual men in a city park .

propbank.arg: for killing two homosexual men in a city park

example.name: passive, without crime
example.text: He was sentenced to 500 hours of community service and restitution to the museum of $ 45,000 .

propbank.arg: to 500 hours of community service and restitution to the museum of $ 45,000

example.name: Example with all but arg 0
example.text: his prison sentence for income - tax evasion

example.name: Arg 0 as a court body
example.text: many people would receive federal death sentences

example.name: Example with args 2 and 4
example.text: A prison sentence of less than three years

example.name: ARG4 and ARG3
example.text: Sears was serving a 30 - year sentence for the self - confessed 1992 killing of his wife in Clinton , Maryland , but after a relentless campaign that included a letter from his psychiatrist saying Sears was unlikely to commit such violence again , the judge in this case , got him released .

propbank.arg: for the self - confessed 1992 killing of his wife in Clinton , Maryland

example.name: args 0, 1, 2
example.text: Their sentencing him to solitary confinement , what a joke .

The crime is often fairly remotely located, especially in cases of"sentence and fine". (from sentence.01-v)

roleset.name: what your english teacher made you write correctly and completely

example.name: Example with both args
example.text: His next sentence about a radio interview ,

example.name: Example of the type of sentence to use this sense for
example.text: the first to use silences and sentence fragments and menacingstares , almost to the exclusion of what we previously understoodto be theatrical dialogue
